May 6, 2016

Registration Open for the Summer Leadership Institute

Three days, captivating speakers, the ultimate location! Join us in Palm Springs for a luxurious 3-day retreat full of learning, networking, and fun. This year’s theme is Community for All—Our Promise, Our Challenge. At the Summer Leadership Institute, you’ll:

  • Engage with disability leaders as they share knowledge and best practices
  • Learn how to build more inclusive communities
  • Strengthen your leadership skills
  • Make invaluable connections with other staff and professionals
  • Unwind with golf courses, hot springs, the hotel spa, hiking, biking, and more.

Take advantage of our Early Bird Rate while it lasts! Register today.

Announcing: Summer Leadership Institute Scholarship Recipients

We are pleased to announce the 2016 Summer Leadership Institute Recipients of the First Time Attendee Executive Director and the First Time Attendee Next Generation Leader Scholarships.
  • Executive Directors
    • Stacy Gillet, The Arc of King County, WA
    • Addison Roberts, The Arc of Wichita County, TX
    • Nancy Stimson, The Arc Alliance, PA
    • Monica Wiggins, The Arc Alliance , PA
  • Next Generation Leaders
    • Melinda Plue, The Arc of North Carolina, NC
    • Sharise Proctor, The Arc of Union/Cabarrus, NC
    • Melanie Soto, The Arc, AZ
    • Donna Tracy, The Arc of Tri-Cities, WA

Professional Development Seminar-Save the Date!

Kick off your National Convention experience with the Professional Development Seminar (formerly known as Pre-Convention) at the Hilton Orlando Lake Buena Vista. Join your peers and colleagues on October 28 — 29 as we examine issues encompassing leadership, organizational effectiveness and the competencies and programming needed to successfully meet the needs of a diverse I/DD community in the 21st century through the lens of “Disney’s Approach to Leadership Excellence.”
  • October 28: This half day program provided by the world renowned Disney Institute, will bring time-tested insights to how leadership and communication can be enhanced within our organizations.
  • October 29: The second half day will bring attendees together to strategize on using the Disney methods in their own organizations and work with their peers to find solutions to common leadership challenges.
Whether you are an Executive Director, staff in the fields of advocacy, finance, programs, human resources, a board member for a state or local chapter, or a member of the disability community, this program will speak to your work. NCE members save $100 on registration! Interested in joining NCE? Reach out to Ilyse Kramer at kramer@thearc.org or 202.534.3707.

Nominate Yourself or a Colleague for A NCE Distinguished Professional Award

We are excited to announce that the NCE Distinguished Professional Awards Application is open until May 15. This year, we are pleased to introduce four new awards:
  • Exemplary Career Leadership: Executive Directors/CEOs retiring during the period of November 1, 2015 and September 30, 2016, who have been part of The Arc movement for at least ten years.
  • Exemplary Mentor: CEOs/Executive Directors whose mentorship of one or more NCE member(s) has resulted in the mentees’ demonstrated professional growth.
  • Diversity and Cultural Competency: Executive Directors/CEOs who have successfully leveraged the skills of their staff to provide innovative program(s) that meet the needs of a diverse I/DD community.
  • Program Innovation: Executive Directors/CEOs whose chapters have successfully designed and implemented an innovative program to meet the needs of people with I/DD in their community.
Nominate yourself or a colleague for an award today!

Silent Auction: We Need Your Help!

Every year at National Convention, The NCE Silent Auction raises scholarship money to help send NCE members to professional training opportunities throughout the year. But first, we need things to auction! We are excited to announce that we have started off donations with a week's vacation to a popular destination of your choice through one of our generous donors who owns a timeshare. Help us bring in more wonderful items by contributing now. Please contact Carrie Hobbs Guiden at cguiden@thearctn.org to donate.
